conclusion: Need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are labeled A, B, and C. The containers are labeled D and E.
Liquid will flow through the baffles in the order A, B, and C, then enter one of the containers (D or E).
Baffle A is at the top and appears to be a horizontal barrier.
Baffle B is below A and also appears to be a horizontal barrier.
Baffle C is on the right side and appears to be a vertical barrier.
Liquid will flow from A to B to C, influenced by the orientation of the baffles.
Flow will be directed towards the container positioned at the end of the path.
Containers D and E are at the bottom.
Liquid will flow into the container aligned with the path of the baffles.
Liquid will flow into container E.
